channel.title: 2017 Lacrosse Weekend – Indigenous Values Initiative
channel.description: NYA WEÑHA SKÄ NOÑH: Thank you for being well

item.title: The Schedule for Deyhontsigwa’ehs- The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: Thursday 28 September through Sunday 1 October, 2017 Onondaga Nation, Syracuse University, Syracuse, New York Passport Stamping Come get your Haudenosaunee Confederacy Passport Stamp. It is often considered the hardest passport stamp in the world to get. Bring your passport … Read More
item.content:encoded:
Thursday 28 September through Sunday 1 October, 2017
Onondaga Nation, Syracuse University, Syracuse, New York

Schedule Updates Listed Below

Passport Stamping

Come get your Haudenosaunee Confederacy Passport Stamp. It is often considered the hardest passport stamp in the world to get. Bring your passport and get it stamped.

Update: Passports will be stamped Friday at 3:00pm

 

 

Schedule for The Wooden Stick Festival

The Wooden Stick Festival is Free!. The festival will be located outdoors in the space between the Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes (Onondaga Nation Fieldhouse) and the Outdoor box.

Thursday September 28th

  • 10 am Opening
  • 10:45 am Oren Lyons
  • 11:30 am Freeman “Bossy” Bucktooth
  • 12:15 pm Haudenosaunee Dancers and Singers
  • 1 pm Thompson Brothers (still TBD)
  • 2 pm Alfie Jacques
    • Legendary wooden lacrosse stickmaker with over 50 years experience in the craft.
  • 3 pm Break/ Possible Speaker
  • 4 pm Haudenosaunee Dancers and Singers
  • 5 pm Spirit Game: Pride of a Nation Panel
  • 6 pm Movie

Friday September 29th

  • 10 am
  • 11 am Travis Gabriel (lacrosse stick maker)
  • 12 pm Haudenosaunee Dancers and Singers
  • 1 pm Coach Desko
  • 2 pm Alfie Jacques
  • 3 pm Jeanne Shenandoah
  • 4 pm Haudenosaunee Dancers and Singers
  • 5 pm Spirit Game: Pride of a Nation Panel
  • 6 pm Movie

Saturday September 30th

  • 10 am Ed Shenandoah and Neal Powless the International experience of coaching
  • 11 am Ansley Jemison
  • 12 pm Haudenosaunee Dancers and Singers
  • 1 pm Kanentokon Hemlock
  • 2 pm Alfie Jacques
  • 3 pm Miss Indian World Raven Swamp
  • 4 pm Haudenosaunee Dancers and Singers
  • 5 pm Spirit Game: Pride of a Nation Panel
  • 6 pm Movie

Sunday October 1st

International Scrimmage @ the Carrier Dome
  • UPDATE: The Box office at Gate B will open at 9:00am
  • UPDATE: Gates (A,B,C,E) will open at 10:00am and tickets will also be on sale at those gates as well.
    • Gate A is the main gate and where merchandise will be on sale.
    • Gates A&C are accessible gates.
  • The Updated schedule is as follows:
    • Game 1: 10:30 a.m.-11:30 a.m. Iroquois vs Israel
    • Game 2: noon-1 p.m. Albany vs Israel
    • Game 3: 1:30-2:30 p.m. Albany vs Iroquois
  • Tickets will be $10.00 (Ticket go on sale Sept. 25 at 10:00 am via this Ticketmaster link)
    • Kids 12 and under are $6
  • Parking will be $5.00 (Update: West Campus Lots)
    • UPDATE: Gate A is preferred because it is at ground level and wheelchair accessible. Archbold strip is the accessible drop off, accessible parking is available in Irving Garage and there is an elevator to the crosswalk and gate C.

Water

  • Indigenous Values Initiative will be selling bottled water $1.00.

Food

  • There will be lots of traditional Haudenosaunee foods, including corn soup and buffalo burgers.

ATM

  • There will be an onsite ATM for those that need cash.

Charging Stations

  • Diversegy will be on site providing solar-powered charging stations. Think Green. Be connected.

LASNAI BOX TOURNAMENT SCHEDULE

2017 LASNAI Box Tournament Schedule & Preview

Below is the schedule for the LASNAI game times and location. There will be 21 teams playing games over three days which means lacrosse fans have the exciting opportunity to see games not only indoors at Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes (the Onondaga Nation Fieldhouse) but also at outdoors in the legendary outdoor box as well!
The 2017 LASNAI Box Tournament Schedule is also available for download as a PDF.

LASNAI Tickets

In order to attend the LASNAI Box Tournament you will need to purchase tickets. There will be tickets for sale at the door each day on a first come first serve basis. However if you buy your tickets now you can get a three day pass for $25 and the chance to see up to 63 Lacrosse Games! That’s less than 40 cents a game. You can’t beat it.

Purchase LASNAI Event Passes HERE.
Day passes will be available at the door each day for $15, and Kids (10 & under) get in for only $5.

LASNAI Teams

The Full LASNAI Team List with descriptions

Teams
Basom Bombers (IRO) Blue Goose LC (CAN) Brooklyn Dodgers (USA)
Casey Powell World Lacrosse Foundation (USA) Caughnawaga Indians (IRO) Cleveland Demons (USA)
Courage Game House Team (USA) Frog Pond Maulers (IRO) Goldstar Tel Aviv (ISR)
LaserSharks Blanco (USA) LaserSharks Neon (USA) LAS House Team (USA)
LCC Radotin (CZE) Music City (TN and KY – USA) Onondaga Redhawks (IRO)
Rochester River Monsters (USA) Seneca Marksmen (IRO) St. Lawrence River Wolverines (IRO)
Syracuse Stingers (IRO/USA) Thompson Brothers Lacrosse (IRO) The Young Guns (IRO)

 

Directions

Tsha’Thon’nhes

Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes – Onondaga Nation Fieldhouse
315-498-9163
3370 Route 11A
Onondaga Nation Nedrow, NY 13120
Google maps
Bing
Apple Maps

Parking

  • Parking will be available in driveways and fields on Rte. 11A/Syracuse Tully Valley Road for approximately $5.00. UPDATE: There will be limited Free Parking.
  • There is a gravel lot in front of Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes – Onondaga Nation Fieldhouse that will be available exclusively for pickup and drop-off.

Thompson Brothers Youth Lacrosse Camp for Indigenous Students only

  • 9/29 – 10/1: Thompson Brothers N7 Lacrosse Camp
  • (Grades 3-12)
  • Exclusive to Native American Campers
  • September 29 4:30pm-9:00pm
  • September 30 9:00am-4:0pm
  • October 1 9:00am-12:00pm
  • Followed by Iroquois Nationals vs Syracuse Orange at the Carrier Dome
    Download flyer

Social Media

Be on the look out for some exciting prizes and give aways.
The event hashtags are #laxweekend17 and #LASNAI.
Who to Follow:

LASNAI

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • YouTube

Indigenous Values Initiative

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Snapchat

Wooden Stick Festival

  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Online Streaming

LASNAI will be streaming the Box Tournament Live on their YouTube page.

Social Media Contests

  • Stay tuned for some exciting contests.

Raffle

  • Indigenous Values Initiative Will be Raffling off an original Alf Jacques Wooden Stick!. Raffle Tickets are $10.00 and can be purchased only at the Indigenous Values Booth. All proceeds go to benefit Indigenous Values.

Wooden Lacrosse Stick made by Alf Jacques.

Sponsors

  • Nike N7
  • Onondaga Nation
    • Tsha’Hon’nonyen’dakhwa’ – (Where They Play Games)
    • Tsha’Thoñ’nhes – (Where They Play Ball)
    • OAC – Onondaga Athletic Club
  • Thompson Brothers
  • Lax All Stars North American Invitational
  • Syracuse University
    • Chancellor Syrverud
    • Athletic Department
    • University College
    • Government & Community Relations
    • Department of Religion
  • Upstate Medical Center
  • One Bowl Productions
  • Honey Sweet Production
  • “The Good Mind”
  • Onondaga Community College
  • Gannon’s Ice Cream
  • Colonial Laundry
  • Costco
  • Green Hills Farms
  • Wegmans
  • M&T Bank
  • Dunkin Donuts
  • Visit Syracuse – Nikita Jankowski
  • WSYR 9 – Bridge Street – Tim Fox
  • WSTM 3 – Weekend Today – Laura Hand
  • DINO 105.3 FM – Nick Caplan
  • REBEL WXTL 105.9FM – Dave Frisina
  • Fast Signs

item.title: UPDATED: Carrier Dome Scrimmage Schedule
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: The final event of the Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend, hashtag #laxweekend17, will be a three way scrimmage between the Syracuse University Men’s Lacrosse Team, The Iroquois Nationals, and Team israel Lacrosse. These scrimmages are sure to delight fans. … Read More
item.content:encoded:
Schedule Change: The Israel vs. Syracuse Scrimmage will now take place at 12:30

The final event of the Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend, hashtag #laxweekend17, will be a three way scrimmage between the Syracuse University Men’s Lacrosse Team, The Iroquois Nationals, and Team israel Lacrosse. These scrimmages are sure to delight fans.

Tickets can be purchased soon for $10 with parking available for $5.

Schedule

  • Iroquois vs. Israel (11:00)
  • Israel vs. Syracuse (12:30)
  • Syracuse vs. Iroquois (3:00)

Download the Carrier Dome Scrimmage Flyer

For more about all the exciting things happening during the Lacrosse Weekend like the Lacrosse All-Stars North American Invitational (LASNAI) Box Lacrosse tournament see our page on the Lacrosse Weekend. The event hashtag is: #laxweekend17 .

Select Highlights of Deyhontsigwa’ehs

  • LASNAI Box Tournament at Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes (The Onondaga Nation Field House). Advance 3 Day passes are $25.00. Day of passes will be available at the door each day for $15, and Kids (10 & under) get in for only $5.
  • The Wooden Stick Festival will be happening concurrently with LASNAI out at Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes and will be free
  • Thompson Brothers Youth Lacrosse Camp
  • Stay tuned for more

2017 LASNAI Box Tournament Schedule

Below is the schedule for the LASNAI game times and location. There will be 21 teams playing games over three days which means lacrosse fans have the exciting opportunity to see games not only indoors at Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes  (the Onondaga Nation Fieldhouse) but also at outdoors in the legendary outdoor box as well! The 2017 LASNAI Box Tournament Schedule is also available for download as a PDF.

Download PDF

Tickets

The Wooden Stick Festival is free and open to the public. In order to attend the LASNAI Box Tournament you will need to purchase tickets. There will be tickets for sale at the door each day on a first come first serve basis. However if you buy your tickets now you can get a three day pass for $25 and the chance to see up to 63 Lacrosse Games! That’s less than 40 cents a game. You can’t beat it.

Purchase LASNAI Event Passes HERE. 

Day passes will be available at the door each day for $15, and Kids (10 & under) get in for only $5.

item.title: Legacy, Loyalty, and Lacrosse
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: Thanks to Renée K. Gadoua and the College of Arts and Sciences for a detailed write-up of some of the things that will be happening during Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend #laxweekend17 Lacrosse fans, as well as educators and students, will … Read More
item.content:encoded:
Thanks to Renée K. Gadoua and the College of Arts and Sciences for a detailed write-up of some of the things that will be happening during Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend #laxweekend17

Lacrosse fans, as well as educators and students, will enjoy the weekend, which concludes with a Carrier Dome scrimmage featuring the Iroquois Nationals, Syracuse and Team Israel. “We are showcasing world-class lacrosse, but the reason we are involved is that the wooden stick is a reference point for teaching people about the values of the Haudenosaunee,” Arnold says.

 

The Haudenosaunee Wooden Stick Festival will take place Thursday, Sept. 28, to Saturday, Sept. 30, on the Onondaga Nation. The educational festival will showcase speakers and demonstrations of lacrosse, wooden stick making, native food, arts, traditional dance and culture, and sovereign representation at the United Nations. “Spirit Game: Pride of a Nation” will be shown twice daily. The documentary, produced by One Bowl Productions in partnership with the Haudenosaunee, premiered in Syracuse in June and features Haudenosaunee leaders and lacrosse players. Admission to the festival and film are free.

Syracuse University Men’s Lacrosse to host a triple scrimmage between Iroquois Nationals and Team Israel. The Scrimmage will take place in the dome Sunday October 1. Tickets are $10.00 and parking is $5.00

via: Legacy, Loyalty, and Lacrosse

item.title: 2017 Box Tournament LIVE Pool Group Drawing on Saturday
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: The LASNAI Box Tournament team list is now set. There will be 21 teams competing for trophy. The Round Robin pool groups will be announced LIVE on Saturday (Sept. 9) around 1:30 p.m. Eastern Time. There will be two pots, one “A” pot and … Read More
item.content:encoded:
The LASNAI Box Tournament team list is now set. There will be 21 teams competing for trophy. The Round Robin pool groups will be announced LIVE on Saturday (Sept. 9) around 1:30 p.m. Eastern Time. There will be two pots, one “A” pot and one “B” pot. The top seven teams based on last year’s results and rosters will be placed in the “A” pot the other 14 teams will go in the “B” pot, and groups will be assigned from there. If fans do not like where their team is placed they should definitely attend the tournament to cheer for their team.  The tournament will be an important part of Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend!

WATCH LIVE

Watch Live

Don’t forget:
You can watch the Pool Group Drawing Live on the LCC Radotin YouTube page Saturday approximately 1:30 p.m. Eastern Time.

 

TEAM LIST

To see the full LASNAI Box Tournament Team List go to: https://laxallstars.com/2017-lasnai-teams-announced/

Team List

 

TICKETS

2017 LASNAI Box Tournament Tickets are now on sale. The Full 3-Day Tournament pass is only $25.00 if it is ordered now.  This is a great deal for fans!  For $25.00 fans can choose from 63 Box Lacrosse Games Three Days. This unique event provides an opportunity to watch the best and greatest players of the game.

FYI…Kids 10 and younger get in for free.

Order Your Tickets

 

THREE WAY SCRIMMAGE

The Syracuse Orange will take on the Iroquois Nationals and Team Israel in the Carrier Dome at Syracuse University.  This three way scrimmage will be packed with be exciting, dynamic and hard hitting lacrosse action.

Stay tuned … tickets go on sale soon!

 

2017 WOODEN STICK FESTIVAL – FREE

As a reminder, the Wooden Stick Festival will be running concurrently with the LASNAI Box Tournament. This event is free to all and will take place at Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes (The Onondaga National Fieldhouse). There will be wooden stick makers, arts, crafts, and delicious food. #laxweekend17

 

2017 LASNAI SCHEDULE

The Schedule Release is slated for Monday, September 11th.  This is welcome news for fans.  The schedule will make it possible for everyone to attend their favorite events.  The 2017 schedule will be posted here and on the LASNAI website.

 

LASNAI LOCATION

Most of the LASNAI Box Tournament will be taking place inside Tsha’ Thoñ’nhes (The Onondaga Nation Fieldhouse). However, a few select games will be played outdoors in the old box.  Fans will appreciate this rare opportunity to watch their favorite players in this setting.  Most of the teams will have the chance to play one or two games outside in the box.

 

For more information see: LAXALLSTARS.com

2017 LASNAI Teams Announced

item.title: Go behind the scenes of Lacrosse and learn about its history and politics
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: Spirit Game: Pride of a Nation, is an exciting film which captures the spirit of the Haudensaunee and of Lacrosse.  Here is a snippet of what Inside Lacrosse has to say: “Each Haudenosaunee community has its own unique struggles, but what … Read More
item.content:encoded:
Spirit Game: Pride of a Nation, is an exciting film which captures the spirit of the Haudensaunee and of Lacrosse.  Here is a snippet of what Inside Lacrosse has to say:

“Each Haudenosaunee community has its own unique struggles, but what bonds us absolutely is lacrosse,” said Lyons. “When talking about our deep connection to this sport it’s important that we convey that message with love and reverence.”

There’s a beautiful segment about the role women play in the game. The joy from this being the first international competition held on indigenous lands jumps off the screen. They document the way in which Oren Lyons, Rick Hill, Tonia Fritchner, and Wes and Kim Patterson founded the Iroquois Nationals. Few sports teams have have done so much for the pride of a people.

A clip which may summarize it all comes from Jeremy Thompson, who speaks over some of the film’s most stunning action shots.

“When I talk about the good mind I talk about good thoughts, giving thanks to The Creator for giving me this game. Sometimes I feel like crying I’m overwhelmed, I’m so happy. If I have to shed a little tear I let it out. That’s what makes me grateful, content. I feel calm until the first whistle. And after that you put your best effort out there. That’s what I do.”

Free showings at Deyhontsigwa’ehs: Creator’s Game Lacrosse Weekend, 28-30 Sept–Fieldhouse @ Onondaga Nation. Check out our website! Catch the excitement and join us for another special moment: “Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend.“

item.title: Syracuse Alumni and Students are excited about #laxweekend17
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: The excitement is building for Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend, Both the Daily Orange and NunesMagician ran articles this week about the upcoming event. The Nunesmagician article is especially interesting because it links to a Sports Illustrated article about the history … Read More
item.content:encoded:
The excitement is building for Deyhontsigwa’ehs-The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend, Both the Daily Orange and NunesMagician ran articles this week about the upcoming event. The Nunesmagician article is especially interesting because it links to a Sports Illustrated article about the history of Lacrosse. if you wish to keep up with all the happenings follow the #laxweekend17 hashtag on facebook, twitter, instagram, and on indigenousvalues.org.

 

The Header image is the Daily Orange sports logo and the NunesMagician Logo.

item.title: Upcoming Scrimmage between Syracuse University, Iroquois Nationals, & Team Israel
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: The Central New York region is excited about the upcoming scrimmage at the Carrier Dome between the Iroquois Nationals, Team Israel, and Syracuse University lacrosse teams. The Indigenous Values Team is working hard on this event so mark your calendars. One … Read More
item.content:encoded:
The Central New York region is excited about the upcoming scrimmage at the Carrier Dome between the Iroquois Nationals, Team Israel, and Syracuse University lacrosse teams. The Indigenous Values Team is working hard on this event so mark your calendars. One of the most inspiring things about this event is is seeing the generous spirit of gratitude being shown for this Haudenosaunee gift of a game we have all come to love, is truly inspiring! For those of you who might not be familiar with Lacrosse, this game was played over 1,000 years ago on the shore of Onondaga Lake. For more about all the exciting things happening during the Lacrosse Weekend like the Lacrosse All-Stars North American Invitational (LASNAI) Box Lacrosse tournament see our page on the Lacrosse Weekend. The event hashtag is: #laxweekend17 

 

For more see: the Syracuse.com article: “Syracuse will scrimmage Iroquois Nationals, Team Israel as part of lacrosse weekend.”

image is a screenshot from syracuse.com

item.title: Syracuse To Host International Scrimmage as part of Lax Weekend
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: Indigenous Values and the Wooden Stick Festival are proud to announce that the Syracuse University men’s lacrosse team has agreed to participate in a scrimmage with the Iroquois Nationals and Israel Lacrosse. These scrimmages are sure to be some of … Read More
item.content:encoded:
Indigenous Values and the Wooden Stick Festival are proud to announce that the Syracuse University men’s lacrosse team has agreed to participate in a scrimmage with the Iroquois Nationals and Israel Lacrosse. These scrimmages are sure to be some of the highlights from the the Deyhontsigwa’ehs The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend.

 

 

article via: Cuse.com Syracuse University Men’s Lacrosse to host international scrimmage

image via: wikimedia
